result.execSummary:
The defendant Bailey Anthony Huot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bailey Anthony Huot is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bailey Anthony Huot was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:32 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bailey Anthony Huot in court, Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court for Bailey Anthony Huot.  INCLUDES 22CM180 and 22CM387. ADA Becker recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CM180 and Ct 1 - Theft - Movable Property in 22CM387. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CM180 and Ct 1 - Theft - Movable Property in 22CM387. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 2-3 in 22CM180 and Ct 2 in 22CM387. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Court orders: 
22CM180
Ct 1 - Retail Theft 
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail STAYED
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No contact with Fleet Farm and Home Depot
- Participate in Restorative Justice
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Random testing by Agent at least one time per month
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

22CM387
Ct 1 - Theft - Movable Property
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail STAYED
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No contact with MacKenzie H.-T.
- Participate in Restorative Justice
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Random testing by Agent at least one time per month
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Filed by DE. arc     Per SJN  Scheduled hearing for 08/18/22 at 1:30 PM

** AMENDED ** 

INCLUDES 22CM180 and 22CM387 - BOND ON FILE

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mackenzie Huot-Thompson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:33 PM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bailey Anthony Huot in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon Elton Stanek appeared by video for Bailey Anthony Huot. INCLUDES: 22CM180 and 22CM387. DE updates address on record. Court notes $400 CA Bond on 22CM180; which is on file as well as a $50 Atty Fee payment.   22CM387 has $250 CA Bond. DE was to call the PD's office to qualify and get Atty Stanek appointed on 22CM387, has not done so.  Court quashes warrant in 22CM180. Attys argue bond; on 22CM387. Court amends bond to include both matters. Court forgives the FTP on 22CM180 and is ordered to resume payments starting 9/1/22. DE should still contact PD's office as he likely qualifies. Court notes next hearing is already set. Adjourned:  1:50 pm.

10:06 AM 10:03 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court for Bailey Anthony Huot. Defendant Bailey Anthony Huot in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CM180 (STC) and 22CM387 (INIT). ADA Becker states that there is a new case set next week for INIT, would like to take it up today if possible. Atty. Stanek is willing to proceed to INIT on new case, currently court-appointed. 22CM387: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. DE is on PO hold. State requests bond. Atty. Stanek makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Court questions public defender appointment for DE. DE will contact public defender's office to apply, Atty. Stanek is willing to take as public defender appointment. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 10:11 AM. kma
